intro: Brandisia kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi brandisia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
